img.alt: File:Flag of Russia.svg

div.p: Flag_of_Russia.svg‎ (SVG file, nominally 1,800 × 1,200 pixels, file size: 261 B)

This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

img.alt: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

a.title: This page is semi-protected against editing.

img.alt: This page is semi-protected against editing.

div.div: Буряад: Ородой Холбооной Улас гyрэнэй туг
日本語: ロシア連邦の国旗
div.p: Государственный флаг Российской Федерации. Цвета взяты из http://www.gov.ru/main/symbols/gsrf3_2.html & http://eng.kremlin.ru/articles/state_insignia_01_2.shtml

p.style: width:30em; border:2px solid #55b05a; margin:1px 0; background:#fff; color:#000;

div.p: W3C ✓ The source code of this SVG is valid
div.pre: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="450" height="300"> <rect fill="#FFF" width="450" height="300"/> <rect fill="#F00" y="195" width="450" height="105"/> <rect fill="#00F" y="100" width="450" height="100"/> </svg>

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction:ltr;

td.span: This image shows a flag, a coat of arms, a seal or some other official insignia. The use of such symbols is restricted in many countries. These restrictions are independent of the copyright status.

span.small: This tag does not indicate the copyright status or the source of the attached work. A normal copyright tag and a source are still required. See Commons:Licensing for more information.

p.span: Alemannisch | Boarisch | Български | Català | Česky | Dansk | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Esperanto | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Hrvatski | Magyar | Bahasa Indonesia | Italiano | 日本語 | ქართული | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | മലയാളം | Plattdüütsch | Nederlands | Polski | Português | Română | Русский | ไทย | Українська | Vèneto | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | 粵語 | +/−

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr;

img.alt: Public domain

td.span: This work is not an object of copyright according to Part IV of Civil Code No. 230-FZ of the Russian Federation of December 18, 2006.

dd.span: Copyright shall not apply to ideas, concepts, principles, methods, processes, systems, means, solutions of technical, organizational and other problems, discoveries, facts, programming languages.
Shall not be objects of copyright:

li.span: official documents of state government agencies and local government agencies of municipal formations, including laws, other legal texts, judicial decisions, other materials of legislative, administrative and judicial character, official documents of international organizations, as well as their official translations;
state symbols and signs (flags, emblems, orders, banknotes, and the like), as well as symbols and signs of municipal formations;
works of folk art (folklore), which don't have specific authors;
news reports on events and facts, which have a purely informational character (daily news reports, television programs, transportation schedules, and the like).

p.span: Full text of the Code: in Russian.

img.alt: Coat of Arms of the Russian Federation.svg

p.span: Comment – According to interstate and international compacts, the Russian Federation is the legal successor of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic and the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics; therefore, this license tag is also applicable to official symbols and formal documents of the Russian SFSR and the USSR (union level[1]).
Warning – This license tag cannot be applied to proposed official symbols and drafts of formal documents, which can be copyrighted.

li.span: ↑ The union level means that use of official symbols and the formal documents of 14 other Soviet Republics is the subject of law of their legal successor. See respective license tags.

p.span: English | Suomi | Français | Македонски | Plattdüütsch | Русский | +/−

div.p: Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 07:14, 16 April 2010
Thumbnail for version as of 17:16, 6 April 2010
Thumbnail for version as of 03:50, 6 April 2010

td.span: (Reduce code and still kept overlapping (I know there is a GOST that asks for Pantone to be used, but the Pantone shades are not defined and the users still see fit to keep these colors.))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:22, 5 March 2010

td.span: (overlapping strips to fix whitepsace issue per request)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 08:21, 11 February 2010
Thumbnail for version as of 15:00, 18 May 2009
Thumbnail for version as of 14:23, 18 May 2009
Thumbnail for version as of 21:09, 6 February 2009
Thumbnail for version as of 02:15, 23 June 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 17:46, 20 June 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 13:37, 11 June 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 23:55, 3 April 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 15:36, 3 April 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 13:55, 23 September 2007
Thumbnail for version as of 17:33, 22 September 2007

td.span: (New colours based on those shown at http://www.vexilla-mundi.com under Russia)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 18:16, 1 September 2007

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 22:51, 6 August 2007 (until a source is provided on the new colors))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:28, 29 August 2007
Thumbnail for version as of 22:51, 6 August 2007
Thumbnail for version as of 05:00, 6 August 2007

td.span: (Colours corrected to the shades commonly seen on official Russian flags.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:51, 18 July 2007
Thumbnail for version as of 17:34, 18 July 2007

td.span: (Reshaded the colours to be more like those used by the Kremlin. Even though these colour shades are most likely incorrect in historical use of the Russian flag. )

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 02:46, 18 July 2007

td.span: (Lightened red just a little to make it closer to what is seen on other existing flags)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:40, 18 July 2007

td.span: (Although the Russian law on the flag does not describe the specific shades of the colours, much like Yugoslavia's government did not the blue has been written to be a sort of azure. The red is slightly darker than seen here. Vexillographers have been know)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 09:11, 28 March 2007
Thumbnail for version as of 16:59, 17 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 06:25, 28 September 2005
